phrases: Vivian, the Sex Pistols, Seven Star cigarettes,
coffee with milk, cake with a strawberry on top.
And the lotus flower.
The things Nana liked were always the same.
I used to think that was cool because I could never stick to one thing.
When I was darkness at that time
With trembling lips
The more I struggle
The more this wound deepens
The broken promise hurt me
Nobody can save me
God, I have only one request
Stop tearing apart my love
I need your love
I am a broken rose
Sorrow tumbling down is your song
All alone with nowhere to go in my life
I need your love
I am a broken rose
Oh baby, help me from frozen pain
With your smile, your eyes, and sing me, just for me
I want to need your love
I am a broken rose
I want to need your love
Is that all you got?
Yup.
I have asked my Mom to send the rest of my stuff for me by courier.
I am going to buy new furniture and anything else I need.
How about you, Nana?
I got my guitar and this.
That is it.
What about your other stuff?
Let us see...
Write everything you need on a piece of paper.
I will send them to you when I get back.
Get back?
Yasu just came up to sign the papers for me.
He lives back home.
Huh?
He is your guarantor?
What about your parents?
- Here is the list, Yasu. -
That was fast.
Oh, I get it!
You ran away from home!
You seem like the type.
And what type is that?
You are really from a posh family
and your parents were against you being in a rock band!
Nana from a posh family?
She is not?
What are you laughing at?!
Let me see, three boxes and... is that it?
It is not even worth the trouble sending.
Do not change the subject!
What about the other apartment?
Are you going to leave it as is?
Do not ask me.
That is not my apartment.
Why do not you ask him?
But he is so busy,
it is almost impossible to get a hold of him.
Then leave it alone.
He is the one that keeps paying the rent.
But that was for you...
I never asked him to.
I was planning to pay my own rent.
Though I admit it was helpful until now.
Hey, what are you guys talking about?
Just stuff like, you can never figure out what rich people are up to.
Hey, that is not nice.
Well then, I guess it is time for us poor folk
to go out shopping for bare necessities.
Yes!
We will first need an air conditioner.
A space heater will do us just fine.
Well, I guess I will be going then.
Huh?!
You leaving so soon?
Why do not you stay a night?
By all means.
Please stay.
Although we cannot provide much hospitality.
Thanks.
I would really love to,
but I have got a lot of work piled up.
Oh right.
You are a lawyer, after all.
We will see you off at the station on our way out shopping.
No, that is okay.
I will get a cab to the airport.
Suit yourself.
Nana, why do not you go see him off at the airport?
I will do the shopping.
Do not worry about seeing me off.
Well then.
Hang in there.
Thanks a lot for everything, Yasu.
Call me if you need any help.
I will be here in a flash.
I was sure that skinhead lawyer Nana calls Yasu
was her boyfriend or something, but Nana was sure quick to deny that.
Yasu was a member of the band I was in back home.
He was the leader and easy to rely on.
So I guess he is kind of like an older brother to me.
But, he came all the way to Tokyo to sign a piece of paper.
To me that spells love.
That spells love?
Yasu's like that with anyone.
Helping others along is second nature to him.
I think he was born to be a lawyer.
Then do you have another boyfriend?
Hey there is a dollar store.
Let us get a bunch of stuff here.
Let us find a shop that has cute stuff.
Then we will go our separate ways.
W-Wait!
Hey Nana, do not you think these cups are super cute?
You would never imagine they are only a dollar each.
Strawberries?
No?
If you want it, go ahead and buy it.
Forget it then.
Why?!
Because.
If you are not interested, I do not want it either.
I want to use the same things you do.
I do not care what we use.
Let us just get the shopping done.
But you do not like this, do you?
The strawberries.
Ah, sure I love strawberries...
Then I am getting these.
I feel for Shoji.
What is that supposed to mean?
Well, you are like... you know.
Kind
Of like a dog.
I am?
You kind of stick around friendly-like and you are real sincere,
but you need a lot of caring.
Like, not that I mind,
I was thinking about getting a pet anyway.
Hey Hachi, want me to buy you a toy?
Hachi?
Do not you have a cuter name for me?
We got a lot of stuff pretty close by.
There are a lot of cute shops around here too,
and the station area is pretty convenient,
considering we are on the outskirts of town.
That is Tokyo for you.
All we need now are futons, a space heater, lights, a fridge, and...
Hey!
Who is going to carry it all?
Look, this looks like a nice furniture shop!
Let us check it out!
We will check out furniture later.
Come along, Hachi.
Aw, but they got cool lighting and stuff.
Oh?
Then just a peek.
All this stuff is really cool!
And cheap!
Well done, Hachiko.
Yay!
Found a cute space heater!
I am getting this for my room.
That looks like a good one for the living room, do not you think?
How cute!
Says it is made in the fifties.
Is it usable?
Not a problem.
It is been fixed up.
Feel free to look around.
Our merchandise is all used goods from the fifties to the seventies.
I go overseas myself and find the real bargains.
I recommend everything here.
Is that so?
So that is why everything's so reasonably priced!
Hey, you are speaking in a different voice.
You can rest at ease.
There is nothing here that is not of good value.
Normally these things would be a lot more expensive.
It is just a matter of me not making any profit.
Hey come on, quit the chatter and make up your mind already.
But they are all so nice, I cannot decide.
Are you looking for something in particular?
Oh, all kinds of things.
We just moved and the apartment's still bare.
How about these folding chairs?
They are a set of two.
We will take'them!
Oh, and how about that?
It is cute and suits your image perfectly.
Then I will take it.
Look at it before you decide.
So you guys are Nana and Hachi?
What a combination.
Well actually, my name is Nana too,
but it is confusing to have the same name, so Nana...
Was that the reason?
It is because you are like a pet dog.
Come by again and take a closer look around.
Yes sir!
We will definitely be back!
Come to think of it,
do you think we can get the refrigerator and the washing machine delivered today?
If you do not mind it being late,
I can bring it over myself after I close up.
You are not that far.
Are you sure?
Thanks.
Then could ya bring this other stuff with ya?
Nana, that is asking a bit much, do not you think?
Do not worry about it.
I am going anyway.
Oh, Mr. Mizukoshi, you are too nice.
Is everyone in Tokyo this nice?
When did you get his name?
Tell you the truth, I would like to go while there is still daylight
and set up your lights for you.
But the kid watching shop for me quit, so I cannot get out.
It is a problem...
If I can do the job, I will work for you!
Wow, am I ever lucky!
I never expected to land a job so quickly!
It is like luck has suddenly landed on me.
Thank you, Demon Lord!
You flirt.
D-Do not get me wrong!
The reason I said I wanted to work there
was because I liked the shop,
not because Mr. Mizukoshi is twenty-nine and cool,
not to mention single...
You checked him out?
But he does not look like he is almost thirty, does he?
I was surprised!
I thought he was in his early twenties.
Oh yeah, you are the love-at-first-sight champion.
H-How do you know that?
You spilled it all out on the train the other day.
M-Maybe I did...
But anyway, I have no idea what you see in that Mizukoshi.
Then who is your type, Nana?
My type?
For example, who is your favorite celebrity?
Sid Vicious!
Of the Sex Pistols?
So you know them.
You listen to the Sex Pistols?
No, but I saw the movie, Sid and Nancy.
Figures.
There are bound to be a few people like this.
Hey, Nana, the futons are on the seventh floor.
Seven again?
Hey Nana, I was just thinking.
What is it, Hachi?
You know how we walk into our apartment with our shoes on?
I mean, Tokyo is not a foreign country.
So what is the big deal?
Well, does not it bother you to lay futons on the floor?
Do not you think it is kind of dirty?
Well then, I guess we could go with sleeping bags.
No!
I will not go for that!
Mizukoshi!
You got beds?!
Thanks for your patronage!
Oh great.
Now we can start living.
And he gave us such a discount.
He is so kind, Mr. Mizukoshi.
Well, if you buy that much off of him, it is to be expected.
Hello!
Nana here!
You are Hachi, remember?
Hi Shoji!
I am out doing some shopping with Nana.
I am not being pushy.
We are getting along fine.
Oh yeah?
Shoji, are you still at work?
Yeah.
But it looks like I am going to get off early tonight,
so you want to meet me for dinner at Jackson?
You said you wanted to go there once.
Oh that place you always go to?!
Sure, I would love to go!
Nana, do you want to join us?
Shoji's treating us to dinner!
Hey!
I never said I was paying!
But Mizukoshi's coming over this evening, so someone'd better be home.
Oh you are right.
Mizukoshi?
Hey no worries.
I will just stay home, so you go ahead on your date.
- But... - Hey Nana!
Hmm...
So you are going to choose Mizukoshi over Shoji?
Hello Shoji?
Where should I meet you, at what time?!
Who the heck is Mizukoshi?
Th-The old man at the furniture shop!
Nana.
Why did you say that?
Shoji heard you.
I know he took it wrong.
And I am going to be working at Mizukoshi's starting tomorrow.
Well then, I suggest you not do anything to make him suspicious.
Come on.
Hey Nana.
I have been looking for this CD.
Would you mind if we look in that shop?
I do not mind, but do you have a CD player?
Well, if you want to use mine, that is fine by me.
Thank you!
I hope they are not sold out.
Great, they still had a few left!
The new Trapnest album went on sale today!
I just love them.
If you would like, you should listen to them, too.
They are super cool.
Hang on a minute while I go and pay for this.
Thanks for waiting!
It came with a poster.
Do not tell me you are going to put that up in the apartment.
Why not?
I am going to put it my own room anyway.
What are you?
A junior high school student?
But I like them so much, I am even a member of the fan club.
They are having a concert soon.
I bought two tickets.
Want To go?
Take Shoji.
That is what I first thought, but on second thought,
I cannot really stand next to Shoji and scream for some other guy.
I like the guy on bass, Takumi, a lot.
Really.
Naoki on the drums is cool, too.
But you got to admit.
The best thing about Trapnest is the vocalist, Layla.
Her voice and her face are so pretty.
I so admire her.
Hey, what about the other guy?
Huh?
The other guy?
You know, the guy on the guitar.
The most noticeable one.
- Oh, Ren? - Just oh?
Sure Ren's cool and he is the most popular,
but he does not say much and he seems kind of scary.
I guess he is not really my type.
What?
What is funny?
Oh, nothing.
Serves you right.
Hey, come to think of it,
Ren kind of looks like Sid from the Sex Pistols, does not he?
You think so?
Sid's a million times cooler.
Nana, you dropped your lighter.
Oh, thanks.
Hey, Nana.
Are you sure you do not mind me going out and leaving you here?
Go ahead.
You are going to be out all night anyway, right?
Do not you have dates or stuff like that yourself?
Not at all.
Do not you have a boyfriend?
Not to speak of.
I thought so.
Huh?
Nana, you actually like Yasu, do not you?
You probably have mixed feelings and stuff,
but if you hang on to that stiff upper lip, you are going to let happiness slip by.
Thanks for the wise words.
Okay then, I am off.
Give my regards to Mr. Mizukoshi, the 29-year-old!
Oh my, your door's wide open.
You would wonder why we had locks put on our doors.
If you hang on to that stiff upper lip, you are going to let happiness slip by.
You like this?
I got it from a street vendor.
It is a Sid Vicious pad lock.
And who are you?
Nancy?
So what are you going to do putting a lock on me?
Hey Ren.
If I were to die, would you die with me?
Okay.
I have spent my whole life feeling lonely.
I do not ever want to be lonely again.
Thanks for a delicious meal!
Everything was so good.
You sure ate a lot!
You are going to get fat.
But it was so good.
Especially the hamburger.
That was the best!
Nana.
If you are going to start working at Sabrina's tomorrow,
come by for lunch.
Sure!
I will come every day.
Looking forward to seeing you, Koichi Sato.
You just met the man and it is like you are best of friends already.
The burgers here,
you can have them prepared for take-out, too, right?
Can I get one to go?
A Jackson burger.
Okay.
You are going to eat more?!
No, it is for Nana.
Oh, I see.
I will make it right away.
Give me a minute.
Nana, are you thinking of going home already?
It is only ten of the clock.
But I want to get the burger to Nana before it gets cold.
Then why do not you go and give it to her, then come on over to my place.
Shoji, are you drunk?
I can see exactly what your motives are.
Come on, it is only once in awhile.
It is not once in awhile.
It is been every day since I arrived.
Yesterday, you said you were tired, yet twice...
There is nothing wrong with that, is there?
We are finally able to see each other every day like this.
You are right.
I still feel like I am in the middle of a dream.
But not today!
Taxi!
Why?
Nana's stuck in that empty room all by herself.
She will be lonely.
That girl's not the kind to get lonely!
Besides what are you catching a cab for?
You live close by.
Let me walk you home.
I will be all right!
I have got a job now!
I want to get this hamburger home while it is warm.
Every minute counts.
Are not you going a bit overboard?
See ya!
You may go now.
You mean to tell me she is fallen in love with that girl?
I am sorry, Shoji.
You can go to Sachiko's place tonight if you want to.
I ran up the seven flights of stairs as fast as I could.
When I opened the door, I could see that the bedding and beds had arrived,
but there was Nana fast asleep by the heater,
wrapped up in a single blanket.
Hey Nana.
You were so cool, strutting your stuff like a stray cat.
Free and proud.
But you always had that hurt in you that could never heal.
Me? I was so footloose and fancy free, I even thought that hurt was cool.
Not knowing how badly it hurt.
I reached into the sky
But I could not reach what I wanted
They grew smaller and disappeared into the sky
Like colorful balloons
I am alone
My hand had no place to go
And gently you took it
Starless night
I will not look back at the shadow of my past
I want to feel your warmth
Tears are falling down
Even if I am unsure I will not let go
Of your hand holding mine
